title: Headsticks + Jack Kendrick – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Headsticks + Jack Kendrick Date: 27/09/2025 Time:2025/09/27 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Screaming Tarts Presents… Headsticks + Jack Kendrick Saturday 27 September 2025 The New Adelphi Club £14 +bf from seetickets Doors: 8.00pm Headsticks With an ever growing fanbase at their side Headsticks are reaching new heights with their self proclaimed ‘Revolutionary Punk Roots Rock’n’Roll’ which has cross genre appeal seeing the band gaining endless plaudits from pillars of the Folk/Roots Post Punk Punk and even the rock and blues fraternities. Sell out shows across the country as well as high profile tour supports with the likes of New Model Army The Men They Couldn’t Hang Ferocious Dog and Terrorvision to name a few have seen the band profile rise.Since late 2012 the band have relentlessly gigged and recorded and their hard work is now well and truly coming to fruition with their albums and their live performances receiving rave reviews from all corners of the musical spectrum as anthemic choruses barbed lyrics irresistible riffs and uplifting beats are combined with a wry sense of humour to deliver social commentary to encapsulate the spirit of this unique band.Whether it’s the full throttle heart pounding stompers the anthemic singalongs or the haunting acoustic ballads Headsticks deliver an experience like no other band built on honesty integrity bloody hard work and a passion for what they believe. + Jack Kendrick Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! title: Queen’s Pleasure + Brünnhilde + Velvet Tuxedo – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Queen’s Pleasure + Brünnhilde + Velvet Tuxedo Date: 28/09/2025 Time:20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU £10 Adv Click Here Twisted Nipple events presents Queen’s Pleasure + Brünnhilde + Velvet Tuxedo Sunday 28 September The New Adelphi Club £10 Adv Click Here Doors: 8.00pm The mighty Queen’s Pleasure return to The New Adelphi Club this September! A contagious force to be reckoned with! Produced by Ed Hartwell (The Kooks The Lathums Jeff Beck) the band are happiest onstage where the 4 members merge into one organism. Their live shows always create something that is difficult to put into words the energy in an inexhaustible resource where you could fixate on each individual member for an entire show. They have supported The Undertones and Noel Gallagher at stadium shows. dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Musicians Night Date: 29/09/2025 Time:2025/09/29 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Free Entry As Always Probably the longest running weekly open mic night in the known universe! Musicians Night Monday 29 September 2025 with your host Phill Wilson at The New Adelphi Club Free Entry As Always Doors from 8pm Featuring some of the regions most talented unsigned acts and some first timers. Musicians Night is full of talented local musicians. You’re most welcome to join us if you’re a performer showcasing your talent or wanting to meet like-minded musicians and build creative relationships. Or if you’re just looking for an evening of unique musical entertainment it’s the best Monday night in town! Free Entry as always. First act on stage around 8.30pm-ish. Please arrive early if you want to perform. *We now have SETMIXER! SETMIXER captures studio-quality multitrack recordings directly from our mixing desk. Every show is recorded mixed and available to the artists by the next morning. The New Adelphi Club was voted UK Grassroots Venue of the Year 2022 by a national public vote. title: The Lovely Eggs – Adelphi Birthday – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events The Lovely Eggs – Adelphi Birthday Date: 01/10/2025 Time:20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU SOLD OUT *This event has SOLD OUT The Adelphi 41 Birthday Celebrations The Lovely Eggs + Support Wednesday 1 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club £22 Advance (at the foot of this page) Doors: 8.00pm For The Lovely Eggs being in a band is a way of life. It’s about art. It’s about creativity and expression. It’s about following your own path and doing things your own way. Holly and David operate on their terms spewing out music records art and television shows before piling in the van and tearing round the country to perform a load of live sold out shows. Their wild and wilful independence sets themselves apart from other bands and despite having no management booking agent record label or publisher their album “I am Moron” shot to Number One in the Official UK Independent Charts and they continue to sell out shows across the country. “I am Moron” bears the fruit of their second collaboration with Grammy award winning producer Dave Fridmann their latest being new album “Eggsistentialism” which was released in May 2024 to critical acclaim and bagged a Top 10 spot in the Official UK Physical sales and Independent albums charts. “The Lovely Eggs are not just surviving they’re thriving” – The Guardian/ “Bleak truths with giddy Popsike bubbling defiance” – MOJO/ “Their best album yet”- John Kennedy Radio X/“The sound of a band who’ve put heir whole lives into their art”- Louder than War ⭐⭐⭐⭐ MOJO/ ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ LOUDER THAN WAR/ ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ HI-FI CHOICE/ ⭐⭐⭐⭐ SHINDIG / ⭐⭐⭐⭐ FAR OUT/ ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ NARC/ ⭐⭐⭐⭐THE PUNK SITE/⭐⭐⭐⭐ LIFESTYLE MAGAZINE/ ⭐⭐⭐⭐ XS NOIZE/ 8/10 UNCUT The band’s two recent singles “Nothing Everything” and “My Mood Wave” both reached Top 40 in the UK Official singles sales charts with “Nothing/Everything” reaching number 2 in the UK vinyl charts. It was accompanied by a music video from internationally acclaimed artists Wood and Har-rison. The pair have collaborated with Godfather of Punk Iggy Pop on single “I Moron” which swiped the number one slot in both the Official U.K. Physical and Vinyl charts. Iggy Pop is a fan of the band and dedicated one of his BBC 6 Music shows to The Lovely Eggs’ work. Holly and David have also released their own TV show: EGGS TV embarking on a televisual odyssey through alternative art music spoken word and underground culture. Teaming up with artist Casey Raymond the 6 part YouTube series sucks you spiralling down the plughole into The Lovely Eggs’ distinctly off the wall universe featuring guests Ian Mackaye Gruff Rhys Stewart Lee John Grant Cate le Bon Maxine Peake John Cooper Clarke and loads more. With releases across the world The Lovely Eggs have played hundreds of gigs around the UK USA & EU. They have produced 7 albums & recorded more than 10 live sessions for BBC 6 Music & Radio 1. With observational and often surreal lyrics The Lovely Eggs have a powerful raw sound that creates the sonic illusion of a band twice their size. They have become known for their ferocious yet joyous live performances. Operating in a world when true authenticity is hard to find The Lovely Eggs are one of the most exciting innovative and genuine bands around. Welcome to their world. Welcome to Eggland.

title: Bag Of Cans + The Caterpillar Spies + Rowan & Friends – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Bag Of Cans + The Caterpillar Spies + Rowan & Friends Date: 02/10/2025 Time:2025/10/02 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Bag Of Cans + The Caterpillar Spies + Rowan & Friends Thursday 2 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets: £10 Advance Doors: 8.00pm With the launch of their debut album ’We Are A Band’ in June 2023 Bag of Cans managed to fool both listeners and their mums around the country. Not only were they very much “a band” but one that could release songs too. In late 2024 an EP called ‘Favourite Shirt’ with such songs as ‘Favourite Shirt’ was released following a couple of years of tours and festival appearances. Capitalising on this momentum they then pretty much immediately decided to take a break from gigging in what is sure to be described as “a 4D Chess move of utter brilliance” and will be studied by industry moguls for years to come as “one of the promotional plays of all time”. Released on Fierce Panda these collections of songs have attracted praise and airtime from BBC Radio 6 and the single ‘Hostage at the Dinner Table’ was a joint winner on Steve Lamacq’s Roundtable. The EP’s titular tune ‘Favourite Shirt’ got a load of inexplicable plays on KEXP in the states which confused everyone even further and no one really knew what to do with that information. As the Cans now return from their slumber they look to the autumn to throw themselves back into a great big puddle of gigs and splash around for someone’s amusement in their tried and tested wellies of slightly-deranged-indie-music. The Caterpillar Spies feature current members and former members of some of Hull’s best bands including LIFE Fonda 500 Bunkerpop Candid Faces Chubby Mam The Favours Stuka and The Rocky Nest… The Caterpillar Spies play gentle wonky songs about the inevitable reality of death life and loving in the 21 century. With a colourful spectrum of slo-fi instrumentation including finger picking guitar bass drums violin piano cello flute melodica glockenspiel tap shoes percussion and joyous group sing-a-longs… subtle and kind… The Caterpillar Spies echo the sounds of such luminaries as Belle & Sebastian Gorky’s Zygotic Mynci and 3 album era The Velvet Underground. + Rowan & Friends Super cute York band featuring Rowan…and his friends.

title: Opus Kink + Magnolia + Wench – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Opus Kink + Magnolia + Wench Date: 04/10/2025 Time:2025/06/19 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Twisted Nipple Events presents OPUS KINK + Magnolia + WENCH Saturday 4 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club £16 Adv from gigantic Doors 7.30pm Be there to witness the return of the critically acclaimed Gods of jazz punk . “Horn-fuelled filth-funk where punk and jazz combine in grimy circumstances” Thomas Smith NME Magazine “Barnstorming infectious” Steve Lamacq BBC 6 Music Joining the alliance of brass It shall be a double injection of sax infused chaos with 7 piece avante-garde band from the land of Norwich – Magnolia “It feels like you’re fumbling in the dark excavating layers to the beginning or the end of the world. From the depths of this crafted cacophony spring chinks of delicate melody – Magnolia are an experience…” – Shit Horse Disco Also… we are excited to welcome back Hull’s band on fire… WENCH “We highly recommended you go and see these young punk warriors from Hull who burned up the BBC Introducing Stage at Leeds/Reading 2025. The two releases they have put out so far are incendiary and a bright future awaits.” Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! title: Jesus Jones + Support – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Jesus Jones + Support Date: 08/10/2025 Time:2025/10/08 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Screaming Tarts presents… Jesus Jones + Support Wednesday 8 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club £25 Adv from seetickets *This event has switched from The Welly. Jesus Jones formed back in 1988 born out of the struggles of everyday bands and their battles to find their own voice. The band’s vocalist guitarist and principal songwriter Mike Edwards was frustrated with a lack of progress and stung by a music business that seemed to have passed them by. That was until he came across an as-yet unproven new technology: sampling. A cheap guitar pedal could be tweaked to grab sounds and replay them twisting them into new forms. That lightbulb moment led to their debut single “Info Freako ” a rapid-fire burst of anarchic sonic attack with breakbeats and funky b-lines josting for attention over walls of brutal guitar and yelped vocals. It quickly set a blueprint and armed with a proper-brand-new sampler their debut album “Liquidizer” soon followed. The press in the UK finally sat up and took notice. Edwards was on a roll. That run of success quickly snowballed as the band released their second album “Doubt” in 1991. The band’s pop sensibilities and innovative approach found new eager audiences worldwide. The album became a phenomenon in the United States selling over a million copies. Their single “Right Here Right Now” became an iconic moment in the language of early 90’s crossover hits racing to the top of the US charts. title: Miki Berenyi Trio + Yasmin Coe + Cherry Seraph – 40th Anniversary Month – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Miki Berenyi Trio + Yasmin Coe + Cherry Seraph – 40 Anniversary Month Date: 21/10/2024 Time:2024/10/21 20:00 Location: 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Venue: Adelphi 40 Anniversary Month – The New Adelphi Club £12 Advance The Adelphi 40 Anniversary Celebrations Former LUSH lead singer/guitarist brings her new band to Hull! Miki Berenyi Trio + Yasmin Coe + Cherry Seraph Monday 21 October 2024 Tickets £12 Advance (on this page) or £14.00 OTD Doors 8.00pm Miki Berenyi Trio are Miki Berenyi on vocals/guitar (Lush) Kevin ‘Moose’ McKillop on guitar (Moose) and Oliver Cherer (Gilroy Mere Aircooled). The three musicians first worked together during Piroshka’s 2021 tour – Miki and Kevin being founder members Oliver coming in on bass to replace Mick Conroy (Modern English) who had moved to the US. When the global pandemic made touring impossible Miki spent the lockdown months writing her memoir Fingers Crossed released in 2022 to widespread acclaim. To provide some musical accompaniment for the string of book events and signings Miki Berenyi Trio was formed. The band has developed a momentum of its own touring with the Wedding Present and Gang of Four and sold out London co-headline show with Aircooled. Miki Berenyi Trio are planning to record and release an album in 2024. Their debut single ‘Vertigo’ was released via Bella Union on May 8 2024 + Yasmin Coe + Cherry Seraph

title: Man The Lifeboats + Support – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Man The Lifeboats + Support Date: 11/10/2025 Time:20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU £15 Adv Click Here Screaming Tarts presents… Man The Lifeboats + Support Saturday October 11 2025 The New Adelphi Club £15 Adv Click Here Doors:8.00pm Man The Lifeboats began life in a shanty-punk folk mosh pit in 2016. Skinny Lister and Holy Moly & the Crackers were the two bands that lit the fire and blew the roof of the Garage that night. Fast forward 9 years and 100+ gigs and Man The Lifeboats are ploughing their full-throttle folked-up furrow on the festival circuit winning over audiences at Moseley Purbeck Warwick Swanage Jurassic Fields Beardy Folk Folk in a Field Bearded Theory Deepdale Ragged Bear and more drawing comparisons to Bellowhead Waterboys Oysterband the Levellers and those folk-punk heroes the Pogues. The second album Soul Of Albion hit no. 27 in the Official Folk Charts in 2022. Recorded at Rockfield Studios it sounds like Led Zeppelin arm-wrestling Shane McGowan in a Birmingham brewery like Jimbo band Fruitbat fronting Fairport Convention like The Albion Band turned up to 11 with their fiddles on fire. Tonic for these troubled times. title: Ryder The Eagle + Roy Molloy + Matt Edible – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Ryder The Eagle + Roy Molloy + Matt Edible Date: 12/10/2025 Time:2025/10/12 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street hull HU5 2RU £10 ADV CLICK HERE Under the Influence presents… RYDER THE EAGLE plus guest Roy Molloy + Matt Edible Sunday 12 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club Hull 14+ | 20.00HRS | £10 ADV DIY hero fallen Romeo karaoke weirdo — the Mexico-based French balladeer is everything (and nothing) you might expect from an art-rock divorcé chasing dreams at your local dive bar. With lo-fi synthy soundscapes lyrical melodies poetic songwriting and cathartic one-of-a-kind performances Ryder The Eagle tells his history with love more than his love stories – coating romantic despair with a chiseled wit that’ll transport you straight into a Kaurismäki movie soundtracked by a caffeine-driven Leonard Cohen. ROY MOLLOY Roy Molloy is best known as the enigmatic long-standing business partner of Australian singer-songwriter Alex Cameron. With his debut solo project Molloy steps into a new artistic space. His music combines krautrock instrumentals dry wit and hard-wrought horn solos. Equal parts storytelling and mood-building Molloy’s set represents a shift toward a more personal expressive sound marking a new chapter in his career as a performer and writer. MATT EDIBLE Matt Edible has been a jewel in the crown of Hull’s music scene for many years. From fronting cult avant-pop heroes Edible 5ft Smiths to The Holy Orders to his latest project Matt Edible & The Obtuse Angels. Matt’s solo shows are intimate affairs that range from goosebump-inducing pin drop moments to raging vocal acrobatics. title: Marcel + Bureau de Change + Bugfacer – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Marcel + Bureau de Change + Bugfacer Date: 13/10/2025 Time:2025/10/13 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street hull HU5 2RU £7.20 Adv Click Here Twisted Nipple Events presents Part of the 41 Anniversary Celebrations Marcel (Belgium) + Bureau de Change + Bugfacer Monday 13 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets £7.20 Adv from gigantic We have loud chaotic noise rock band from Belgium Marcel . Always oscillating between the sublime and the ridiculous they excel in a bastardised experimental form of unorthodox punk which will appeal to your anarchist granny as well as your 5 year old nephew who thinks he’s right wing. While 76% of adults who have seen them live claim to have felt a tingly stinging joy according to the eurobarometer. Their latest album was produced by Ben Hampson (Ditz Lambrini Girls). Plus support from our faves Bureau de Change . The loud and rambunctious crime syndicate no one asked for. Specialising in in sardonic tongue in cheek post punk that topples the white male patriarchy. Opening we have our own riotous force of relentless primal noise from Bugfacer. title: Hans Pucket (New Zealand) + Support – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Hans Pucket (New Zealand) + Support Date: 15/10/2025 Time:2025/10/15 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey St Hull HU5 2RU £5 / PAY WHAT YOU CAN Hans Pucket (New Zealand) + Support Wednesday 15 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club £5 (or) Pay what you can Doors: 8.00pm Though Hans Pucket has been performing frenetic and immediate indie rock in Wellington New Zealand for years their collaboration dates back even further when twin brothers Oliver and Callum Devlin decided to start making music together. In 2014 with Oliver on vocals and guitar and Callum on drums the duo self-released a self-titled EP on Bandcamp. The loose and rambunctious collection of songs caught the ear of drummer Jonathan Nott who quickly joined the band and Oliver says “knew the songs better than we did.” As a three-piece with Callum Devlin now playing bass Hans Pucket released a string of increasingly hook-laden and sophisticated EPs and singles. In 2016 they released the Jalapeño EP and in 2017 put out their breakout single “Fuck My Life ” which boasted a sax-led outro that hinted at a side of the band the Devlins affectionately refer to as “Horns Pucket.” These releases culminated in the band’s first full-length Eczema in 2018 an LP that garnered cosigns from their compatriots The Beths and RNZ. For their sophomore effort No Drama the band decamped to Jonathan Pearce of The Beths’ Auckland studio. Though the result is a much fuller more ambitious sound Hans Pucket decided to stick to their strengths: being a fun live act. “Rather than being a Steely Dan studio band our intention was to make songs that are fun to play live ” says Oliver Devlin. No Drama came together over several years and during its creation the band added multi-instrumentalist Callum Passels who provided all the horn arrangements on the LP. With Pearce producing his other The Beths bandmates Benjamin Sinclair added string arrangements while singer Elizabeth Stokes provided backing vocals. The result is Hans Pucket’s most sparkling and confident collection yet. While it’s danceable and fun it’s also a thoughtful exploration of anxiety a call for empathy in a turbulent time and a relatable reminder that it’s hard to figure things out. “People say ‘no drama’ all the time when they really mean at least ‘some drama ” laughs Callum Devlin of the album title. “It works because No Drama is actually a super dramatic record.” The LP is out October 28 2022 via Hans Pucket’s new label Carpark Records.

dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Skating Polly + Bedsit Date: 16/10/2025 Time:20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Screaming Tarts presents… Skating Polly + Bedsit Thursday October 16 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets on sale NOW Doors: 8.00pm Over the past decade few artists have embodied the unbridled freedom of punk like Skating Polly. Formed when stepsisters Kelli Mayo and Peyton Bighorse were just nine and 13 the Oklahoma-bred band have channeled their chameleonic musicality into a sound they call “ugly-pop ” unruly and subversive and wildly melodic. With Kelli’s brother Kurtis Mayo joining on drums in 2017 they’ve also built a close-knit community of fans while earning the admiration of their musical forebears a feat that’s found them collaborating with icons like X’s Exene Cervenka and Beat Happening’s Calvin Johnson touring with Babes In Toyland and starring as the subject of a feature-length documentary. All tickets go on sale at 10am on Monday 21 July – ticket links coming soon! To warm up for our Keeping Music Live Tour we’re holding a huge all-day event at one of the UK’s most iconic grassroots venues – Hull’s legendary Adelphi Club on Saturday 18 October! Since 1984 this venue has been at the heart of Hull’s music scene and has hosted everyone from Radiohead and Oasis to PJ Harvey and Pulp. It’s more than a venue – it’s a cultural institution! ⚡ The night will feature a special guest headliner alongside performances from WaterBear artists and Hull’s best emerging talent! We’ve got multiple performance slots available to anyone at WaterBear Brighton Sheffield or online plus offer holders and alumni! We can’t wait to warm up for Keeping Music Live in one of the most legendary venues in the country. Hull – we’ll see you on October 18! title: Vegas On Bass + Follow Deep + More – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Vegas On Bass + Follow Deep + More Date: 19/10/2025 Time:2025/10/19 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Vegas On Bass + Follow Deep Sunday 19 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club £5 Tickets (At the bottom of this page) Doors: 8.00pm Vegas on Bass was born in Bologna in 2022 with the plan to create energetic and positive music. Blurry Visions is their debut album released on February 28 2025. Vegas on Bass stand out for their energetic and aggressive sound inspired by the industrial rock of Nine Inch Nails with a sense of struggle and resilience. From the very beginning they stood out for their performances that charged up the audience performing in the clubs and the streets of the city mixing modern rock and melodies straight to the heart. In 2023 they set off on a tour culminating with two dates in London where they were welcomed with great enthusiasm. Riffs drive guitars execute technical moves and the music is big anthemic and epic but the groove is one straight out of the alternative nightclub. The Big Takeover (USA) ..a very electrifying work due to the energy it contains instigating the desire to go out and playing and captivating due to the harmony of the instruments and the enchanting vocals. Roadie Music (BRA) ..all I can say is that the amazing riffs the captivating melodies and the experimental influences blew me away immediately. Indie Tapes (GER) Vegas on Bass prove they’re more than just another band—they’re a movement. An unfiltered defiant burst of sound and emotion ready to shake up the scene and bring a new fearless energy to the world of rock. Odyssey (UK/USA)

title: Emma Pollock (The Delgados) + Broken Chanter – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Emma Pollock (The Delgados) + Broken Chanter Date: 21/10/2025 Time:2025/10/21 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey St Hull HU5 2RU Click Here Screaming Tarts presents Emma Pollock (The Delgados) + Broken Chanter Tuesday October 21 2025 The New Adelphi Club Doors:8.00pm Tickets on now Emma Pollock (The Delgados) Tickets | Tuesday 21 October 2025 at 20:45 A founding member of critically acclaimed Scottish band The Delgados Emma Pollock co-wrote and shared lead vocal duties on the 5 studio albums the band released between 1995 and 2005. 2000’s album ‘The Great Eastern’ was awarded a Mercury nomination. In 1995 Emma co-founded influential Glasgow record label Chemikal Underground and in 1997 co-founded recording studio Chem19 with the band both of which continue to run today. Following The Delgados’ split in 2005 Emma became a solo artist and has since released 3 solo albums; ‘Watch The Firewoks’ in 2007 ‘The Law Of Large Numbers’ (2010) and ‘In Search of Harperfield’ in 2016. title: EVER + Supports – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events EVER + Supports Date: 23/10/2025 Time:20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Click for Tickets EVER + Supports Thursday 23 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets here Doors: 8.00pm EVER is an alternative rock band from North-East Lincolnshire UK. Influenced by the grunge of Nirvana and Pearl Jam – and pumped-up by the scuzzy pop-punk of Green Day – the band built a legion of fans with a series of self-released singles throughout 2024. With their songs grabbing the attention of people worldwide across social media and streaming platforms the band were spotted by Grammy award winning producer Rob Cavallo. A nod of approval from the man responsible for production duties on classic albums like Dookie and The Black Parade is no mean feat and EVER swiftly signed to Cavallo’s management company. Having already landed a spot on EA sports NHL soundtrack with their debut single the band picked up a booking agent and began to take their next steps. Rolling on to 2025 and with appearances at the likes of Live at Leeds and Neighbourhood Festival in Manchester already under their belt EVER have started to plot their adventures further afield. In February the east-coast trio travelled to Los Angeles to record their debut album with Cavallo; in the summer they will appear at festivals including 2000 Trees and Liverpool Sound City. There is much much more to come. Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! Formed by vocalist and songwriter Tom Beer and guitarist Dan Lucas Bull’s mission is simply to make the music they wanted to listen to inspired by their 90’s heroes such Pavement Yo La Tengo and the Pixies. The rest of the band came together through a mix of friendships and happenstance. Drummer Tom Gabbatiss joined after he and Tom jammed together in bars while they were back-packing round Thailand and Kai West had previously used to jump up on stage with the band and “Bez” (verb meaning to dance badly while intoxicated) before they eventually let him play bass.

title: Curtis Eller’s American Circus – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Curtis Eller’s American Circus Date: 25/10/2025 Time:20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire. Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU £12.50 Advance Curtis Eller’s American Circus + Rose Greenwood Saturday 25 October 2025 The New Adelphi Club £12.50 Advance / £15 OTD Curtis Eller is a banjo player songwriter and rock & roll singer. The beloved show business veteran started his career at the age of seven as a juggler and acrobat but has since turned to the banjo because that’s where the money is. The iconoclastic troubadour has spent thirty years relentlessly touring the burlesque houses beer halls underground theatres and punk rock shitholes of North American Europe and Australia where his legendary shows once earned him the title “New York’s angriest yodeling banjo player”. His band The American Circus has developed a devoted international following based on spellbinding stage performances that combine an unsettling vision of American history with silent film style physical comedy and explosive rock & roll energy. The band has released a string of strange and compelling phonograph recordings that present a dreamlike vision of American history where all points in time have collapsed into one. Fans of past recordings have come to expect a hallucinatory historical landscape populated by corrupt 19 century politicians faded Hollywood stars two-bit prize fighters and frequent inexplicable visits from Elvis Presley and Richard Nixon. The ever-evolving cast of musicians spares no effort in their quest to bring Eller’s historically evocative compositions to vivid cinematic life. “A moustachioed New York yodelling banjo player Eller sings for the unsung rump-shakes for the ne’er remembered and leg trembles for histories forgotten. He is a theatre of movement: a twitching twirling time machine whose songs transport you back to the lost annals of history” “Curtis Eller is a born eccentric a throwback to a bygone age of Vaudevillian minstrel entertainment Buster Keaton-esque slapstick humour & circus clowning boxing rings & showgirls but all delivered with a contemporary street attitude; a song & dance man for our times”

title: Joe Solo & Jess Silk – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Joe Solo & Jess Silk Date: 02/11/2025 Time:20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Joe Solo & Jess Silk ( Double headliner) Sunday November 2 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets £10 +bf Doors : 8.00pm Due to popular demand after their co-headline tour at the end of 2024 Joe Solo and Jess Silk are joining forces again this November (2025) to bring their particular brand of often political folk/punk music to venues across the country. Jess Silk is a guitarist singer and songwriter from the Black Country. Her shouty but melodic brand of folk/punk music gets people sitting up and listening. Armed only with an increasingly sticker-covered acoustic guitar lyrics right from the heart and a distinctive gravelly voice that many don’t expect Jess plays to audiences up and down the UK and has shared stages with many well known names among the folk/punk scene. Jess released her debut album Break the Bottle in May 2018 with a packed out show at her spiritual home of Katie Fitzgerald’s in Stourbridge. Since then she’s shared a number of other releases including two live EP’s with tracks taken from shows at Katie’s and HMV Merry Hill. 2020 saw the world shut down and Jess release two (almost completely) self produced EPs the first of which If We’re Damned was put together from songs that had been gathering metaphorical dust on her hard drive and the second There’s A Bar At the End Of the World a collection of songs written between March and August taking their inspiration from the events of the year. At the end of August 2021 Jess released her second full-length album Blitz Spirit and in April 2025 will be releasing her next EP which was recorded at Metway Studios in Brighton. In recent years Jess has appeared at a number of festivals including Bearded Theory Rebellion Beautiful Days and Glastonbury where she shared a stage with Billy Bragg as part of his Radical Roundup on the Left Field stage. In March 2023 Jess played six shows supporting the Levellers and she continues to tour around the UK playing festivals supports and her own headline tours. Joe Solo is an award-winning musician writer poet activist broadcaster and washing machine engineer from Scarborough. His musical odyssey began in 1987 fronting a bash-em-out band at school and has seen him play nine countries either as lynchpin of pop-punk upstarts Lithium Joe or hammering out his unique brand of Folk Punk and Blues in his own right. On top of releasing twenty one albums since 2004 Solo has written a series of children’s books for Unison on social justice and equality; ran a research project on the Hull Pals Battalions in the First World War; hosts a weekly radio show; had one of his poems used in an international campaign to educate on dementia awareness; co-runs ‘May Day Festival of Solidarity‘ an annual event bringing together voices from music poetry and politics to celebrate International Worker’s Day; and has opened for the likes of Paul Heaton & Jacqui Abbott Billy Bragg TV Smith Grace Petrie Pete Wylie and The Blockheads; whilst his songs have been played by John Peel on Radio One Mike Harding on Radio Two and Tom Robinson on BBC6Music. title: Charming Disaster + Support – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Charming Disaster + Support Date: 05/11/2025 Time:2025/11/05 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy now Charming Disaster + Support Wednesday 5 November The New Adelphi Club £7 Advance Doors: 8.00pm Charming Disaster are a goth-folk musical duo based in New York City formed in 2012 by Ellia Bisker and Jeff Morris. Inspired by the macabre humor of Edward Gorey Tim Burton and Charles Addams the murder ballads of the Americana tradition and the dramatic flair of the cabaret they write playfully dark songs about death crime myth magic science and the occult. In their interactive shows songs are selected by chance by audience members who draw cards from the Charming Disaster Oracle Deck—a Tarot-style divination that straddles the line between concert and theatre. Charming Disaster’s music has been featured on the podcast Welcome to Night Vale they have toured the United States and Europe and have opened for Rasputina Voltaire and The Dresden Dolls. Recent appearances include the Rochester Fringe Festival Philadelphia’s Science History Institute Cleveland’s Wizbang Circus Theatre and NYC’s Coney Island Sideshow stage. Their latest album The Double was released in May 2025 to critical acclaim. “Dressed like ghostly prom dates who ran off with the tarot reader the Brooklyn-based pair turned the joint into a gothic cabaret where every strum stomp and stare felt enchanted. With a Gibson from the grave and a deck of cards from the occult they let fate pick the playlist — a high-stakes game of cabaret roulette…The whole thing? Mesmerizing madcap and maybe a little cursed — in the best possible way.” –Unrated Magazine “Live their onstage banter—equal parts sarcastic stage whisper and conspiratorial wink—transforms each set into a midnight salon where clever wordplay and playful repartee keep the crowd on delighted tenterhooks.“ –Grimrose Manor “Bisker and Morris excel at presenting a kind of cabaret of shadows while also providing a safe place to explore the spooky.” –CITY Rochester “One of the most spellbinding acoustic goth-folk-cabaret duos ever to walk the earth.” –Metal Shock Finland “It’s pretty hard to find folk that is as spellbinding as it is humorous but Charming Disaster executes such a feat while barely breaking as much as a cold sweat…It’s kind of like Coven meets the Carpenters or Captain & Tennille if they had barely escaped the collapse of the Process Church with their lives and immortal souls intact.” –I Thought I Heard a Sound “The song…builds and builds with the most delightful sense of dread imaginable. If you’re the type of person that finds the macabre fun and intriguing you’re going to adore “Cherry Red.” –If It’s Too Loud “There is just no bad spot to start with in Charming Disaster’s catalog…the natural world and metaphysical realm are explored with a murder ballad folk noir and tense cabaret hybrid that no one else could replicate.” –Tom Haugen Take Effect Reviews “Glorious…the kind of soundtrack you’d expect to find on a 1930s cartoon about a Prohibition-era Voodoo funeral…just be careful if they offer you a drink.” –Goldmine Magazine

title: Sam Scherdel – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Sam Scherdel Date: 08/11/2025 Time:2025/11/08 19:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Sam Scherdel + Diddie Hair + Amelia Quinn Saturday 8 November The New Adelphi Club Tickets £10 + bf Doors: 7.00pm 14+ with an Adult ( over 25) Sam Scherdel has rapidly become one of the most talked-about new voices in British alternative music. Since the release of his debut EP in February 2025 his Springsteen-esque storytelling gravel-soaked vocals and electric live shows have marked him out as one of the most exciting emerging artists in the North of England. Having sold out headline shows and appeared at Glastonbury Tramlines and Humber Street Sesh Sam now heads back out on the road in 2025 ahead of the release of his highly-anticipated second body of work. Expect emotionally charged lyricism big heartland choruses and the raw energy that has earned him a rapidly growing reputation across the UK. We welcome Sam back to The Adelphi ahead of his first headline show at the club having previously played here in April 2024. title: Pentire + Support – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Pentire + Support Date: 15/11/2025 Time:20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Click Here Under The Influence presents… Pentire + Support Saturday 15 November The New Adelphi Club £12.00 Adv Click Here Doors: 8.00pm Pentire are an indie band who make pop songs for the post-jangle generation through the smiles and sweat of the mosh pit. This Herefordshire four-piece tell cheap lager-soaked stories of student life a small-town upbringing and the innocence of youth. Brought up on a diet of The Killers Paolo Nutini and Stereophonics frontman and principal songwriter Jack formed a band with his best mate Owen in the sleepy town of Ross-on-Wye. The two friends met drummer Jake and bass player Jacob whilst at university which cemented the four-piece that is now selling out venues across the UK. With previous support from tastemakers such as Jack Saunders (BBC Radio 1) Steve Lamacq (BBC 6Music) John Kennedy (RadioX) and Spotify’s Fresh Finds playlist the band completed a landmark sold-out UK tour in early 2024. dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Hawklords Date: 16/11/2025 Time:2025/11/16 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Screaming Tarts presents Hawklords. Sunday November 16 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets £18.50 Doors: 8.00pm Described by the band as “a coda” to the TIME SPACE and RELATIVITY concept albums Hawklords 2025 album Faith examines aspects of the human metaphysical world and ties together ‘loose strands’ from the TSR trilogy. Designed to be much more of a cinematic audio release this album delivers a blend of soundscapes and thought-provoking songs which have all been crafted to give the listener a completely immersive space-rock experience. From the bludgeoning power of STRANGE LAND through to the sci-fi short story TETHERED this is HAWKLORDS ‘Musik Cinematique’ at its best. Featuring a powerhouse collective of musicians brought together under the Hawklords banner to create this enthralling spectrum of ‘Space-Rock & Roll’. Originally formed in 1978 from the ashes of The Sonic Assassins by Robert Calvert and Dave Brock of Hawkwind this British Space-Rock Band has toured the UK and Europe consistently since rebooting in 2008. https://www.seetickets.com/…/the-new-adelphi-club/3465049 Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! title: Steady Habits + SloWaltz – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Steady Habits + SloWaltz Date: 19/11/2025 Time:2025/11/19 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU £8 Advance Steady Habits + SloWaltz Wednesday 19 November 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets £8 Advance/£10 OTD Doors 8.00pm A flair for alt-country sounds melodic pop-hooks and a voice that can blast it to the back of the room Steady Habits is centred around the lyrical narrative of New-England native Sean C. Duggan. Holding a place in “the youthful side of Americana” [Country Queer] Duggan’s songwriting is poignant with a sensitivity and grit that is reminiscent of artists like Jason Isbell Dawes & BJ Barnham [American Aquarium]. Pinned as one of the UK’s ‘Best of UK Country & Americana’ [Holler] Steady Habits has performed across the UK & Internationally supporting artists such as The Hanging Stars Our Man in the Field Morganway & Demi Marriner and have performed at a number of of high-profile festivals such as The AMA UK Conference Black Deer Truck Festival & the Long Road Festival . Sean was featured as a finalist for Holler’s song writing competition for ‘Deviate’ a joyful and semi-autobiographical song about his upbringing as a young queer kid in the US. “Best of British Country & Americana “​ Holler 2024 “An excellent band with tremendous potential…an exciting blend of 90’s nostalgia” Americana UK “…some mighty clever songwriting that lands on the youthful side of americana merging pop hooks with alt-country twang” ​Country Queer ​ “With a blend of country and folk influences Steady Habits’ genuine camaraderie and seamless vocal harmonies create a captivating experience for their listeners.” ​-DC Brown ​ “Steady Habits show that they have something really special to offer.”​ -Yorkshire Times + SloWaltz Exciting project by acclaimed songwriters Martin Clappison and Tom Kay. Known locally for their time together in The Mighty and The Moon their extensive solo work and projects such as The Broken Orchestra Martin and Tom have joined forces once again and returned with an intimate atmospheric indie folk sound drawing inspiration from the likes of Nick Cave Kathryn Joseph and Radiohead. Expect haunting melodies raw emotion and a soundscape that lingers long after the last note fades.​

title: Avalanche Kaito + Evil Will Prevail + Buckfast Tramp – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Avalanche Kaito + Evil Will Prevail + Buckfast Tramp Date: 26/11/2025 Time:2025/11/26 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey St Hull HU5 2RU £8 Advance Avalanche Kaito + Evil Will Prevail + Buckfast Tramp Wednesday 26 November 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets: £8 Adv/£10 OTD Doors 8pm Avalanche Kaito Belgium Trio Avalanche Kaito bring their fusion of post-punk no wave and afro-groove to The Adelphi as part of a rare UK tour. The band are made up of guitarist Nico Gitto drummer Benjamin Chaval and singer the Burkina Faso griot Kaito Winse. “Mixing up the West African folk traditions of urban griot Kaito Winse with the avant-punk of Belgian guitarist Nico Gitto and French drummer/producer Benjamin Chaval Talitakum is the second album of joyful noise from transnational trio Avalanche Kaito. It is both more cohesive and wide-ranging than their debut hardened on the road but still crammed with rough-edged vigour. Their sound is a striking molten blend that sparks and shakes with life. Driven by an unstoppable uplifting energy this is a record in touch with music’s ritual power … This is a twenty-first century sound that contains and connects with the past. Afropunk futurism. The eternal ecstatic impulse.’ ”The Quietus “… [Kaito Winse’s] stream of consciousness method of singing (where he converses with his ancestors) could be compared to that of original Can vocalist Malcolm Mooney in that he is a single free spirit performing within an otherwise tightly disciplined group of musicians: drummer Benjamin Chaval and guitarist Nico Gitto erect rhythmic electronically pulsed structures – with enough elasticity for Winse to bounce his extraordinary vocal around through a selection of spoken recitations bird calls and lyrical flute exhalations…..” The Wire

title: 999 + The Crooked 45 + Zero Cost – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events 999 + The Crooked 45 + Zero Cost Date: 24/09/2022 Time:2022/09/24 20:00 Location: 89 De Grey Street Hull HU52RU Venue: 999 + The Crooked 45 + Ketamine Kow – The New Adelphi Club Click to Buy The Breakfast Club presents Punk Legends 999 + The Crooked 45 + Zero Cost + DJ Liquidizer Saturday 24 September 2022 £15 Advance from https://www.seetickets.com/event/the-breakfast-club-presents-999/the-new-adelphi-club/2289987 999 will celebrate their 46 anniversary on 5 December 2022. The reason for their longevity is not airplay massive publicity hype or even a major recording deal but word of mouth and that “word of mouth” now extends to nearly every country on earth. 999 were first conceived in late 1976 when Nick Cash (vocals/guitar) and Guy Days (vocals/lead guitar) who were at school together decided to form a group. Within a couple of months they had teamed up with Jon Watson (bass) and Pablo Labritain (drums) and 999 were officially born. Their first gig was at the Northampton Cricket Club in January 1977. Interest in the band was immediate and constant gigging around London brought with it critical acclaim and a hard core following of supporters from Southall calling themselves “The Crew”. These ranks were soon swollen by the Manchester Birmingham Edinburgh Munich Vienna Zagreb Stockholm Oslo Berlin New York LA. Toronto Philadelphia and San Francisco “Crews” each proving as dedicated as the last. The frenzy and raw energy of the early days were captured by their debut single “I’m Alive on the bands own Labritain label and sold well enough to become a minor hit. Next through their association with United Artists records the second and third singles “Nasty Nasty” and the now classic “Emergency” were released both scaling the lower reaches of the charts and confirming 999 to be one of the major forces in the British New Wave Movement. The first album titled simply “999” was released and was greeted with impressive sales and critical acclaim. Extensive touring took them throughout Britain and Europe where they now encountered full houses. The second album “Separates” was released and immediately the single “Homicide” leapt straight into the UK top forty without any Radio airplay and was banned by the BBC and most radio stations. Early 1979 saw the band embarking on their first U.S. tour which was an achievement in itself as they were still without a record deal in America at the time. Response to the band was ecstatic all the venues being filled and import albums being sold out in a rush of enthusiasm. The band were immediately booked for a return trip. Since leaving United Artists 999 have recorded another eleven albums. Jon Watson was replaced in 1986 on bass by Danny Palmer and subsequently by Arturo Bassick in 1991. To date the band have completed 15 U.S. tours 101 London gigs 36 UK tours and 24 European tours visiting Finland Sweden Norway Germany Belgium Holland France Spain Portugal Italy and Yugoslavia Japan Argentina and Brazil. We are delighted to welcome 999 back The Adelphi for the first time in four and a half years. This will be a great night. title: The Froot + Wynona Bleach + Evie Barrand – 40th Anniversary Month – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events The Froot + Wynona Bleach + Evie Barrand – 40 Anniversary Month Date: 23/10/2024 Time:2024/10/23 20:00 Location: 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Venue: Adelphi 40 Anniversary Month – The New Adelphi Club £7.50 Advance Part of The Adelphi 40 Anniversary Celebrations The Froot + Wynona Bleach + Evie Barrand Wednesday 23 October 2024 The New Adelphi Club £7.50 Tickets on this page /£9.00 OTD Doors 8pm The Froot Homegrown Hull heroes bringing you their refreshing 60’s & 70’s pysch- rock influenced sounds to the Adelphi’s 40 anniversary month. Always a brilliant live experience these boys have been working hard building up a national following and have recently been in the studio as they prepare to release new material very soon. Wynona Bleach One of the most exciting prospects coming out of Northern Ireland currently signed to Fierce Panda who released their debut album ‘Moonsoake’ which sold out immediately and is now on its second vinyl pressing. They’ve played Reading and were hand picked by Jerry Cantrell to support Alice in Chains on their Irish dates. Last year they played New Colossus festival in New York alongside 10 massively successful shows at South by South West support October Drift on the Belfast date of their tour and were tour support for Ash on their Irish dates. Picking up national radio support from Steve Lamacq on BBC6Music Huw Stephens and Annie Mac. They have a new single out in June this year ahead of the album with full PR campaigns and label support for both.

title: Sarel’s Mid-Life Crisis Birthday Bash – Warm Exit + No Peeling – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Sarel’s Mid-Life Crisis Birthday Bash – Warm Exit + No Peeling Date: 11/12/2025 Time:2025/12/11 19:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU PWYL Sarel’s Mid-Life Crisis Birthday Bash featuring… Warm Exit (Brussels) Thursday 11 December Doors: 7.00pm EARLY FINISH! We’ll all be wrapped up in bed by 11.00pm PAY WHAT YOU LIKE! + No Feeling (Nottingham) Warm Exit is a post-punk quartet based in Brussels Belgium formed in 2020. Their music blends a raw intense energy with influences ranging from post-punk and industrial avant-garde to kraut and noise. With a sound that echoes the spirit of bands like Birthday Party LCD Soundsystem and PIL Warm Exit’s debut album Ultra Violence explores the darker corners of post-punk. The record moves between contrasting tempos and dynamic energy levels with vocals that range from haunting whispers to powerful raw screams. The band’s soundscape features moments of dissonance evocative spoken word and industrial textures creating a compelling atmosphere for listeners. + No Peeling Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events The Annual Adelphi Darts Tournament 2024 Date: 07/01/2024 Time:2024/01/07 19:00 Location: 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Venue: The Annual Adelphi Darts Tournament 2023 – The New Adelphi Club Free Entry / £3 to play The 21 Annual Adelphi Darts Tournament 2024 For the coveted Jimmy Trophy Hosted by the Prince of Dartness himself… MC Chris Cagney See The Adelphi transformed into ‘The Lakeside’ for the famous annual all-comers sporting event. 3 boards on stage 64 players enter there’s only one winner! Decide on your darts name e.g. “Oche Bilboa” crayon the name onto an old shirt… Let’s Play Darts! Everyone welcome. Chuck some arras or throw some banter at the compere. Spectators welcome. Registration from 7.15 pm starting at 8 pm. Maximum 64 participants so don’t be late! Special prizes for best name and spot prizes throughout the night. £3 entry to play spectators go free. Doors at 7.00pm. First round (one game of 101) should start around 8.00pm. It’s just for fun ! title: The Lowest Pair + Support – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events The Lowest Pair + Support Date: 23/01/2026 Time:2026/01/23 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Screaming Tarts presents The Lowest Pair Friday 23 January 2026 The New Adelphi Club £14 Adv from seetickets click here Doors 8pm Kendl Winter and Palmer T. Lee are two kindred spirits who first met on the banks of the Mississippi while touring the Midwest festival circuit. Born and raised in Arkansas Winter found herself drawn to evergreens of the Pacific Northwest as well as the boundless music scene of Olympia Washington. She released solo records on Olympia-based indie label K Records and performed in ramblin’ folk bands and anarchic punk bands before serendipitously meeting Palmer T. Lee in 2013. Lee had built his first banjo when he was 19 from pieces he inherited and began cutting his teeth fronting Minneapolis string bands before convincing Winter that they should form a banjo duo. Now as The Lowest Pair they have spent a decade performing thousands of shows across North America and the UK and have a new record planned for 2026.Tickets on sale now >>>https://www.seetickets.com/…/the-new-adelphi-club/3502519 Mailing List If you would like to receive up-to-the-minute listings direct to your inbox every week just fill in the short form below! title: Dominie Hooper + Support – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Dominie Hooper + Support Date: 28/01/2026 Time:2026/01/28 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU £10 Advance Dominie Hooper + Support Wednesday 28 January 2026 The New Adelphi Club Tickets £10 Adv (on this page) Doors: 8.00pm Dominie Hooper is a London-based singer songwriter and multi-instrumentalist crafting spellbinding music rooted in folklore ritual and emotional transformation. Her songs simmer with raw intensity and lyrical barbs blending growling cello textured guitar and collective vocals into something dark unsettling and beautiful. Her debut single for Lost Map Records Land produced by Ben Hillier (Depeche Mode Nadine Shah) is a powerful meditation on healing and self-reclamation. Written while reflecting on her upbringing in the wilds of Dartmoor the track conjures a landscape of isolation memory and grounded magic. “It’s about choosing the path of healing again and again ” Dominie explains. “Magic folklore and myth offer archetypes through which we can flip our own script.” Dominie’s sound draws comparisons to the brooding drama of PJ Harvey and John Parish the raw emotional weight of Magnolia Electric Co. and the timeless power of Richard & Linda Thompson. Her commanding voice and blistering live band have already earned her support slots with This Is The Kit multiple UK headline tours and appearances at festivals including Shambala Deer Shed and Moseley Folk. With early support from BBC 6Music BBC Introducing Radio 2 and RTÉ 2 plus backing from Help Musicians and PRSF Dominie is poised for a breakout year. Her upcoming debut album In This Body Lives due for release on Hallowe’en 2025 promises to deepen the spell. As Under the Radar Magazine put it “The breadth of her talent is immediately apparent.” “Endlessly engaging and thrilling” – Guy Garvey BBC 6Music “Absolutely beautiful” – Shaun Keaveny “Spine-tingling” – Roddy Hart BBC Radio Scotland “Amazing amazing track” – BBC Introducing

title: Keeley + Support – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Keeley + Support Date: 26/02/2026 Time:2026/02/26 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey St Hull HU5 2RU Buy Now Screaming Tarts presents… KEELEY + support Thursday February 26 2026 The New Adelphi Club *** TICKETS ON SALE FRIDAY AT 10AM *** KEELEY Tickets | Thursday 26 February 2026 at 20:45 Doors: 8.00pmKEELEY fronted by singer guitarist songwriter and charismatic Dubliner Keeley Moss enjoyed a transformative year in 2024. On 18 October they released their second album “Beautiful Mysterious” on Tiny Global Productions.An album brimming with songs that showcase the breadth of KEELEY’s songwriting bristling with lush harmonies muscular beats and inventive atmospherics weaving gleefully between indie-rock sub-genres and further establishing Keeley Moss as one of Ireland’s most creative songwriters.From the glorious haze of “Doorway To Another World” to the pulsating motorik beat of “Trans-Europe 18” aided by mixes from veteran producer Paul Tipler (Stereolab Placebo The House Of Love) Keeley and producer Alan Maguire make sure each song is a confection a box of musical chocolates stamped with a unique Irish swirl. The live band went from strength to strength in 2024 playing blistering support sets to Echobelly Terrorvision Miki Berenyi Trio and The Smyths and also enjoyed their first-ever festival date with a triumphant appearance at the Shiiine On Weekender. They are currently a trio featuring Keeley Moss on guitar and vocals Lukey Foxtrot on bass and former Morrissey drummer Andrew Paresi. Maybe Armchair Anarchist and Two Headed Yellow Bellied Hole Digger? But how about Celebrated Working Man? And what about those B-sides? Over five years in the early 90s Hull’s finest indie rockers produced almost 30 tracks that never made it on to albums; the likes of Everything’s Changed Since You’ve Been To London Kissing Under Anaesthetic I’m In Love and Another Bad Dose of Home Truths. For the first time ever the band will play a set including all their A- sides and a selection of their favourite back up tracks. A-Sides B-Sides In-sides. title: Mr. Irish Bastard – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Mr. Irish Bastard Date: 19/03/2026 Time:2026/03/19 20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Click Here Screaming Tarts presents Mr. Irish Bastard + Support Thursday March 19 2026 The New Adelphi Club Adv Tickets £16 from seetickets Doors: 8.00pm Mr. Irish Bastard is one of the most formidable and recognised bands amongst the celtic punk genre around the world today. Staying true to the name the band was formed by purebred Irish Bastard Chris Lennon in Münster Germany after a night on the lash with fellow drunkard and deviant Jan Strecker. Armed with an acoustic guitar and a banjo the duo quickly recruited a motley crew of likeminded Irish (and German) hooligans and set off to conquer the world one Irish pub at a time. Four months roughly three hundred pork pies ninety packs of cigarettes fifty seven litres of Jameson and 3 concussions later the band emerged from the studio with their first attempt “St. Mary’s School of Drinking”. Seven songs about everything from drinking to… erm… drinking. … And the rest is history. History they will never remember unfortunately because well… alcohol. Which makes it kinda hard to write a band biography but according to Google Mr. Irish Bastard has shared the stage with bands of high ilk such as The Pogues Dropkick Murphys The Levellers and Flogging Molly (to name a few) and performed at some of the most prestigious festivals in Europe such as Wacken Rock Harz and Open Flair. dateText: Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events The Annual Adelphi Darts Tournament 2025 Date: 04/01/2025 Time:2025/01/04 19:00 Location: 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Venue: The Annual Adelphi Darts Tournament 2025 – The New Adelphi Club Book your seats soon The 22 Annual Adelphi Darts Tournament 2025 Saturday 4 January For the coveted Jimmy Trophy Hosted by the Prince of Dartness himself… MC Chris Cagney See The Adelphi transformed into ‘The Lakeside’ for the famous annual all-comers sporting event. 3 boards on stage 64 players enter there’s only one winner! Decide on your darts name e.g. “Oche Bilboa” crayon the name onto an old shirt… Let’s Play Darts! Everyone welcome. Chuck some arras or throw some banter at the compere. Spectators welcome. Registration from 7.15 pm starting at 8 pm. Maximum 64 participants so don’t be late! Special prizes for best name and spot prizes throughout the night. £3 entry to play spectators go free. Doors at 7.00pm. First round (one game of 101) should start around 8.00pm. It’s just for fun ! 2024 Champion – ‘Keen Kong’ (pictured below) could not wander the streets of Newland all year because of autograph hunters. title: The None + The 113 + Rothco. – 40th Anniversary Month – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events The None + The 113 + Rothco. – 40 Anniversary Month Date: 19/10/2024 Time:2024/10/19 20:00 Location: 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU Venue: Adelphi 40 Anniversary Month – The New Adelphi Club £12 Advance The Adelphi 40 Anniversary Month The None The 113 Rothco Saturday 19 October 2024 The New Adelphi Club £12.00 Advance Tickets Doors 8.00pm THE NONE is a new band of lifelong musicians. Comprising bassist Gordon Moakes (Bloc Party Young Legionnaire) vocalist Kaila Whyte (Blue Ruth Youth Man) guitarist Jim Beck (Cassels) and drummer Chris Francombe (Frauds) they make an uncompromising vision of noise rock with melody at its heart. The band formed at the start of 2023 and bonded over hours in the rehearsal room – making noise discussing shared obsessions and most importantly playing together. The anonymity of their name reflects a creative approach which favours egoless experimentation and open collaboration. This ethos the combined decades of music making and the unique musical identities of all four members can be clearly heard in the art they create. The band are gearing up for debut shows and releases in 2024. Fans of Shellac The Jesus Lizard Silverfish and Unwound will likely find plenty to enjoy. The 113 is a conjuration of a dark and visceral post-punk. The genre-bending project combines heavy guitars and racing rhythms with cathartic and emphatic melodies. Pounding through flesh and bone their music is overwhelming and their songs are absolute bangers but not exclusively suited for the dancefloor. The 113 is as much for the mosh pit kids in the front as for the timid music freaks in the back. Rothco. came storming out of the blocks for their debut show in April and blew the roof of The Adelphi. Post punk/agit punk/fuzz punk…featuring musicians from Hull royalty Rothco. are destined to leave a massive scar on the East Yorkshire coast. Brilliant!

title: Barnstormer 1649 (Attila The Stockbroker) + Blyth Power + Indignation Meeting – The Adelphi Club in Hull
dateText:
Home The Music Capital of Hull HOME ABOUT HISTORY PATRONS CIC – Community Interest Company FILMS PODCASTS Jacko’s Jukebox New Music Mondays WHAT’S ON NEWS SHOP MEMBERSHIP CONTACT PERFORM AT ADELPHI HIRE THE VENUE GENERAL ENQUIRES Events Barnstormer 1649 (Attila The Stockbroker) + Blyth Power + Indignation Meeting Date: 09/04/2025 Time:20:00 Location: Hull East Yorkshire Venue: The New Adelphi Club – 89 De Grey Street Hull HU5 2RU £10 Adv Barnstormer 1649 (Attila The Stockbroker) + Blyth Power + Indignation Meeting Wednesday 9 April 2025 The New Adelphi Club Tickets: £10 Adv / £12 OTD Doors: 8.00pm So pleased to bring this to one of Attila’s favourite venues…. Attila the Stockbroker’s early music punk band Barnstormer 1649 are celebrating 30 years together with five Northern dates in April and Attila has invited his long-time fellow travellers and musical soulmates Blyth Power and punky young rail enthusiasts Indignation Meeting along for the ride. And to make a packed evening even more so he’ll be performing some of his latest and most topical poems in the changeovers. Soaring melodies words which echo down through history a substantial number of songs about trainspotting and apparently at least one poem about circumcision at 67; but don’t let that put you off! Please come.
